body: Just did a quick test and it's working for me: https://snack.expo.io/@bluebill1049/test-usecontroller can you follow up with reproducible codesandbox or expo snack before I close this issue as couldn't reproduce the problem?

@bluebill1049 this is strange. I was initialising/defaulting the defaultValue to '' in my controlled component and now I have to leave it uninitialised in order to make it work with defaultValues

```
...
const { name, control, defaultValue = '', ...otherProps } = props
const { field } = useController({ control, name, defaultValue })
...
```
can you share a codesandbox/expo snack? @rpopovici i can take a look at it.

> https://snack.expo.io/yqw1AsthU

Why do you need to provide inline `defaultValue` with empty `string`?
I don't need it. I did it out of convenience.. in case you don't provide defaults via defaultValues or defaultValue

I see, I would change that to `undefined` for `defaultValue`. it's either `defaultValue` or `defaultValues`, the inline `defaultValue` is overwritten with `defaultValues` provided and this aligns with the behavior when working with Field Array.

Hello! I think, I have the same issue with 7.8.0, although I haven't tested with an earlier version.
I have a controlled select, which gets its options as a prop, and I've set `defaultValue` to the first option. But when I want to use that select for editing existing data populated by `defaultValues`, `defaultValue` will be preferred:

```
// Assuming
defaultValue = 'foo'
defaultValues[path] = 'bar'
```

For uncontrolled components 'bar' will be used. For controlled components 'foo' will be used. I would expect them to behave the same.

Here is an example: https://snack.expo.io/bnbfzHDOk

> Just did a quick test and it's working for me: https://snack.expo.io/@bluebill1049/test-usecontroller can you follow up with reproducible codesandbox or expo snack before I close this issue as couldn't reproduce the problem?

I took your example and just added a defaultValue line 16 to demonstrate the problem
```ts
  const { field } = useController({
    control,
    name: 'test',
    defaultValue: 'this-should-not-be-displayed'
  });
```

Of course there should be no defaultValue needed in this case, but for example in my case (select component) I need both `defaultValue` and `defaultValues` (prioritized) for the same field.
hmmm, looks like we used to take `defaultValues` over `defaultValue`... I will adjust that instead.

@bluebill1049 this behaviour is not documented at all(the fact that you need to leave the defaultValue undefined in the controlled component when using hooks) and I find it strange that it needs to be like that. there is no reason for it

@simonedelmann field level defaultValue should override form level defaults. it makes sense to be like this. local overrides global..
